com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.tab

Class TabView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.tab.TabView

  • public abstract class TabView
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a live view of a single Player List a player sees when pressing tab. Changes in this view can be sent to multiple players or all players on the server. Many methods are available to ease the setting of text and ping values in this view.

    To obtain a TabView instance, call the createTab(int, int) method with the desired dimensions of the tab specified. It is only possible to create new tabs this way when enabling your plugin. To create new Tab View instances at runtime, call clone() or cloneResize(int, int). Pay close attention to the Java Docs of these methods!

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TabView DEFAULT
      A TabView constant that denotes the default view, that is, the player names and their ping
      static TabView EMPTY
      A TabView constant that denotes an empty view, where all available slots are cleared
      static int MAX_HEIGHT
      The maximum allowed height of a Tab View (amount of rows)
      static int MAX_WIDTH
      The maximum allowed width of a Tab View (amount of columns)
      static int PING_1
      A ping value constant that shows a single green line.
      static int PING_2
      A ping value constant that shows two green lines
      static int PING_3
      A ping value constant that shows three green lines
      static int PING_4
      A ping value constant that shows four green lines
      static int PING_5
      A ping value constant that shows five green lines
      static int PING_DEFAULT
      A ping value constant that represents the default ping value, which is equal to PING_1
      static int PING_FULL
      A ping value constant that shows all green lines
      static int PING_NONE
      A ping value constant that shows 'X - no connection'
      static java.lang.String TEXT_DEFAULT
      A text value constant that represents the default 'no text', which shows empty (no) text

      • setColumn

        public void setColumn(int column,
             java.lang.String[] text,
             int[] ping)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single column. Points outside of the text or ping array bounds are ignored. If the text or ping arrays are null, the values are ignored. The text is set from top to bottom
        Parameters:
        column - - x-coordinate of the column
        text - values, null or empty to ignore
        ping - values, null or empty to ignore

      • setColumn

        public void setColumn(int column,
             int y1,
             int y2,
             java.lang.String[] text,
             int[] ping)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single row. Points outside of the text or ping array bounds are ignored. If the text or ping arrays are null, the values are ignored. The text is set from top to bottom

        To set the values in reverse, simply use y2 for y1.

        Parameters:
        column - - x-coordinate of the column
        y1 - - y-coordinate of point 1 (start) of the column (inclusive)
        y2 - - y-coordinate of point 2 (end) of the column (inclusive)
        text - values, null or empty to ignore
        ping - values, null or empty to ignore

      • setRow

        public void setRow(int row,
          java.lang.String[] text,
          int[] ping)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single row. Points outside of the text or ping array bounds are ignored. If the text or ping arrays are null, the values are ignored. The text is set from left to right
        Parameters:
        row - - y-coordinate of the row
        text - values, null or empty to ignore
        ping - values, null or empty to ignore

      • setRow

        public void setRow(int row,
          int x1,
          int x2,
          java.lang.String[] text,
          int[] ping)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single row. Points outside of the text or ping array bounds are ignored. If the text or ping arrays are null, the values are ignored. The text is set from left to right

        To set the values in reverse, simply use x2 for x1.

        Parameters:

        x1 - - x-coordinate of point 1 (start) of the row (inclusive)
        x2 - - x-coordinate of point 2 (end) of the row (inclusive)
        text - values, null or empty to ignore
        ping - values, null or empty to ignore

      • setArea

        public void setArea(int x1,
           int y1,
           int x2,
           int y2,
           java.lang.String[] text,
           int[] ping)
        Sets all the text and ping values of an area. Points outside of the text or ping array bounds are ignored. If the text or ping arrays are null, the values are ignored. The text is set from left to right

        To set the values in reverse, simply use x2 for x1 and y2 for y1.

        Parameters:
        x1 - - x-coordinate of point 1 (inclusive)
        y1 - - y-coordinate of point 1 (inclusive)
        x2 - - x-coordinate of point 2 (inclusive)
        y2 - - y-coordinate of point 2 (inclusive)
        text - values, null or empty to ignore
        ping - values, null or empty to ignore

            int y1,

            int y2,
            java.lang.String text,
            int ping)
        Sets all text and ping values in the area to the text and ping values specified. Ordering of xy1 and xy2 is not important.
        Parameters:
        x1 - - x-coordinate of point 1 (inclusive)
        y1 - - y-coordinate of point 1 (inclusive)
        x2 - - x-coordinate of point 2 (inclusive)
        y2 - - y-coordinate of point 2 (inclusive)
        text - to use
        ping - to use

      • setAll

        public void setAll(java.lang.String[] text,
          int[] ping)
        Sets all the contents of this Tab View to the text and ping arrays. Elements outside of these arrays or if the arrays are null are not set.
        Parameters:
        text - array, null or empty to ignore
        ping - array, null or empty to ignore

      • setAll

        public void setAll(TabView view)
        Sets all the contents of this Tab View to contain the contents of the Tab View. If the Tab View is larger than this one, only a portion that can fit in this Tab View is transferred over.
        Parameters:
        view - to set to

      • setAreaText

        public void setAreaText(int x1,
               int y1,
               int x2,
               int y2,
               java.lang.String... text)
        Sets all the text values of an area. Points outside of the text array bounds are ignored. If the text array is null, the values are ignored. The text is set from left to right.

        To set the values in reverse, simply use x2 for x1 and y2 for y1.

        This is an overload for setArea(x1, y1, x2, y2, text, ping) to allow variable arguments instead of fixed arrays.

        Parameters:
        x1 - - x-coordinate of point 1 (inclusive)
        y1 - - y-coordinate of point 2 (inclusive)
        x2 - - x-coordinate of point 1 (inclusive)
        y2 - - y-coordinate of point 2 (inclusive)
        text - to set to, null or empty to ignore (nothing happens then)

      • setRowText

        public void setRowText(int row,
              int x1,
              int x2,
              java.lang.String... text)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single row. Points outside of the text array bounds are ignored. The text is set from left to right.

        To set the values in reverse, simply use x2 for x1.

        This is an overload for setRow(row, x1, x2, text, ping) to allow variable arguments instead of fixed arrays.

        Parameters:
        row - - y-coordinate of the row
        x1 - - x-coordinate of point 1 (start) of the row (inclusive)
        x2 - - x-coordinate of point 2 (end) of the row (inclusive)
        text -

      • setRowText

        public void setRowText(int row,
              java.lang.String... text)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single row. Points outside of the text array bounds are ignored. The text is set from left to right.

        This is an overload for setRow(row, text, ping) to allow variable arguments instead of fixed arrays.

        Parameters:
        row - to set
        text - to set to

                 int y2,
                 java.lang.String... text)
        Sets all the text and ping values of a single row. Points outside of the text array bounds are ignored. The text is set from top to bottom.

        This is an overload for setColumn(column, y1, y2, text, ping) to allow variable arguments instead of fixed arrays.

        Parameters:
        column - - x-coordinate of the column
        y1 - - y-coordinate of point 1 (start) of the column (inclusive)
        y2 - - y-coordinate of point 2 (end) of the column (inclusive)
        text -

        Parameters:

        text -

      • setAllText

        public void setAllText(java.lang.String... text)
        Sets all the text contents of this Tab View to the text array. Elements outside of this array or if the array is null are not set.

        This is an overload of setAll(text, ping) to allow variable arguments instead of fixed arrays.

        Parameters:
        text - to set to, null or empty to ignore (nothing happens then)

        Returns:

      • displayTo

        public void displayTo(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Displays this Tab View to the player specified. The player is added to the viewers, previous viewers are not removed. If you wish to hide this Tab View again, use displayTo on the DEFAULT or EMPTY constants.
        Parameters:
        player -

      • displayToAll

        Displays this Tab View to all online players and all players that will join in the future.

      • cloneResize

        public TabView cloneResize(int newWidth,
                  int newHeight)
        Creates a new clone of this TabView that is of a smaller size than this one.
        Parameters:
        newWidth - for the tab, smaller than the width of this tab
        newHeight - for the tab, smaller than the height of this tab
        Returns:
        cloned tab of the new size

      • subView

        public TabView subView(int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height)
        Creates a new Tab View that is a sub-area of this Tab View. Any changes made to this returned Tab View operate on this original Tab View.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left start position in this Tab View
        y - - coordinate of the top-left start position in this Tab View
        width - of the sub-region in this Tab View
        height - of the sub-region in this Tab View
        Returns:
        a Tab View instance that is a sub-view of this one
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the area specified is not a sub-area of this one

        protected int getIndex(int x,
           int y)
        Gets the index (for a 1-dimensional array) from an x and y coordinate. Also performs a bounds check.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate
        y - - coordinate
        Returns:
        1D-index

      • createTab

        public static TabView createTab(int width,
                int height)
        Creates a new TabView. This method can only be called while enabling your plugin. Do not call this method while players are joining or logging in - it does NOT work!

        If you need tab instances created at runtime, use clones from one tab created when enabling your plugin. You can use smaller sizes than the original tab, but you can not use larger sizes. You are restricted to defining the maximum tab size you expect to need when enabling.

        Parameters:
        width - for the new tab
        height - for the new tab
        Returns:
        new Tab

      • getController

        protected static CommonTabController getController()
        Obtains the Tab Controller used to communicate changes to the server
        Returns:
        tab controller
